column1: Electric Current!Q=I/t!V = IR!I = Q/t!n = Sin i/sin r!4!Electric Current is the rate of flow of electrons in a conductor. The SI Unit of electric current is the Ampere.
Ohm's Law!I = VR!p = RA/L!V = IR!H = I^2RT!4!Ohm’s law states that the voltage across a conductor is directly proportional to the current flowing through it
column2: provided all physical conditions and temperatures remain constant. Its SI Unit is Ohm.

column1: Electical Power!P = W/t!I = Q/T!n = Sin i/sin r!p = RA/L!2!Electric power is the rate at which work is done or energy is transformed into an electrical circuit. Its SI Unit is Watt.

Force!F = pm!F = ma!F = mv^2r!F = mv!3!Force is an external agent capable of changing a body’s state of rest or motion. It has a magnitude and a direction. The direction towards which the force is applied is known as the direction of the force
column2: and the application of force is the point where force is applied.Its SI Unit is Newton

column1: Common Salt!NaAl!H2O!CO2!NaCl!5!Its is the salt which we use in our kitchen for cooking food.
Calcium Carbonate!CaCO3!CaNO3!AgCl2!CaCO2!2!Calcium carbonate is a dietary supplement used when the amount of calcium taken in the diet is not enough. Calcium is needed by the body for healthy bones
column4: and heart. Calcium carbonate also is used as an antacid to relieve heartburn

column1: Velocity!V = d/t!F = ma! I = V/R!d = mass/volume!2!It can be defined as the rate of change of the object’s position with respect to a frame of reference and time. Its SI Unit is m/s.

Density!d = distance/time!d = mass/volume!F = mass*acceleration!P = work/time!3!The density of material shows the denseness of that material in a specific given area. A material’s density is defined as its mass per unit volume.
acceleration!a = d/t!a = c/b!a = g/m!a = v/t!5!Acceleration is defined as The rate of change of velocity with respect to time.Its SI Unit is m/s^2
Work!Work = Force x Distance!Work = Distance/Force!Work = Force/Distance!Work = Distance + Force!2!
